original_title: Japan, India, France to announce launch of Sri Lanka’s debt restructuring negotiation process
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Japan, India and France will announce the launch of the debt restructuring negotiation process on Sri Lanka on Thursday in the margins of the Spring Meetings, an official International Monetary Fund statement said.
The three creditor countries. which have been closely working on towards a coordinated debt restructuring for Sri Lanka, will announce the launch at a media briefing in Washington.
The virtual participation of Sri Lanka President Ranil Wickremesinghe and physical participation of State Finance Minister Shehan Semasinghe have been tentatively scheduled.

Shunichi Suzuki, Japanese Minister of Finance, Masato Kanda, Japanese Vice Minister of Finance, Indian Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, and France’s Treasury Director General Emmanuel Moulin, Director General of the Treasury will be representing the three creditor nations.  (Colombo/April12/2023)
